title.value: A Feasibility Study: Insertion of Inert Alpha Dart Seeds in Orthotopic Rectal Mice Models
title.justification: This is the only specific study mentioned in the provided text relating to the insertion of DaRT seeds in mice models.
title.quote: A Feasibility Study: Insertion of Inert Alpha Dart Seeds in Orthotopic Rectal Mice Models

extractions.description: The study investigates the feasibility of inserting inert Alpha DaRT seeds in orthotopic rectal mice models using a novel ^{224} Ra-based interstitial treatment modality to treat solid tumors.

type.justification: The study involves a practical experiment using mice models to test a new treatment modality, characteristic of empirical research.
type.quote: In this study, a feasibility study using tumors grown in the rectum of the mice through an orthotopic intra-rectal injection of colorectal adenocarcinoma cells, was studied as well as an intra-rectal injection of inert DaRT seeds.

name.justification: The research is conducted by the Medical Physics Unit, Department of Oncology, focusing on a medical treatment modality.
name.quote: Medical Physics Unit, Department of Oncology, Faculty of Medicine, McGill University, Montreal, QC, Canada

name.justification: The study is centered around a novel brachytherapy treatment modality using radioactive seeds in tumors.
name.quote: In brachytherapy, radioactive seeds are placed directly inside a solid tumor which ensures a conformal dose to the tumor.

name.justification: The research involves using diffusing alpha-emitter radiation therapy (DaRT) for treating tumors.
name.quote: Recently, a novel ^{224} Ra-based interstitial treatment modality relying on diffusing alpha-emitter radiation therapy (DaRT) has been introduced to treat solid tumors.

name.justification: The study uses an orthotopic rectal mice model to study the feasibility of intra-rectal injection of cells and DaRT seeds.
name.quote: In this study, a feasibility study using tumors grown in the rectum of the mice through an orthotopic intra-rectal injection of colorectal adenocarcinoma cells, was studied as well as an intra-rectal injection of inert DaRT seeds.

is_contributed.justification: The model is specifically used in the study, implying it was contributed for this research.
is_contributed.quote: In this study, a feasibility study using tumors grown in the rectum of the mice through an orthotopic intra-rectal injection of colorectal adenocarcinoma cells, was studied as well as an intra-rectal injection of inert DaRT seeds.

is_executed.justification: The model was actively used to perform the feasibility studies described.
is_executed.quote: The orthotopic intra-rectal injection resulted in a 80% tumor success rate.

is_compared.justification: There is no indication that this model was compared to other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: No other models are mentioned in comparison with the orthotopic rectal mice model.

referenced_paper_title.value: A Feasibility Study: Insertion of Inert Alpha Dart Seeds in Orthotopic Rectal Mice Models
referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is central to the study conducted in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A Feasibility Study: Insertion of Inert Alpha Dart Seeds in Orthotopic Rectal Mice Models
